Name: John Muriango
Title: Dirty
Review: Please be watchful and careful as you walk around the park. Unfortunately, people spit everywhere since they chew tobacco and other drugs. Sad.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Also called Victoria's park
Review: This is the place where once Queen Victoria's statue was installed before .Surprisingly to view it one needs to pay park entry fees that have been handed over to private entities to run and maintain .

Name: Tanvi
Title: Good park
Review: The park is good . Visited her with my family . Enjoyed a lot here felt relaxed and peaceful here . My kids liked it .

Name: Yogesh P
Title: Situated in Heart of the Lucknow
Review: This park is situated in heart of the city area. Environment was very calm and peaceful. Awesome place for spending quality time.

Name: Reyan11
Title: Memorial
Review: To commemorate Begum contribution in 1857 revolt. This place is well known for eye catching fountains , trees and flowers

Name: niya27
Title: Near Parivartan Chowk
Review: This park can be easily accessible by public transportation. The park is well maintained and clean. Rs 10 entry ticket is there. Photography is also allowed without any charges. Victoria memorial is also there in the park.

Name: saurabh k
Title: Nothing interesting
Review: Located near pariwartan chowk, don't waste your time visiting this place, if you want to pay visit you may visit chowk and see imambara, which is just few miles away.

Name: Niraj K
Title: Ideal Place for Walkers
Review: This is a big park located just opposite to Hotel Clark's Awadh. The nearest Metro station is K.D. Singh Babu Stadium. A good place for morning and evening walkers on its Walking Path. enjoy fresh air with greenery. Evening is crowded.

Name: nirmalsrivastava1000
Title: My first park
Review: This was the first park that i visited in my life .I went there with my uncle when i was very small .I have many memories there .I visit the park from time to time with my friends just to dive into the memories.

Name: Nandana1
Title: Park in memory of Begum Hazrat Mahal
Review: Very famous and old park in lucknow. Very spacious and good for morning or evening walk. Natural park and good for picnic. Kids will play and enjoy a lot. Very clean and well maintained.

Name: Syed K
Title: A nice but big park
Review: Begum Hazrat Mahal Park is in heart of Lucknow, i.e. Hazratganj. Sine its such a big space, its used mostly by schools for their annual function performances.

Name: YatriForever
Title: Just another park..
Review: Have been here before.Since the park is in central part of the city and close to where I was staying in River Bank Colony, I visited again. The park could be kept cleaner. Nothing much to see in the park, good for a brisk walk.

Name: liferocks24
Title: a nice park in the heart of the city
Review: the park is quite huge and located in the heart of the city. facilitates a good outing to the families on a weekend or a holiday. the park is green with good lawns and few structures. nice place to relax and spend time with family. one must carry food n water to make it more interesting. kids would love the place.

Name: Kashinath H
Title: history unwinds the royal life of Lucknow
Review: good to see .Sharing auto walas are hard working.But the cleaniless on the road is in is worst.Smell of stench Paan may offend you

Name: Aarav K
Title: Beautiful and Memorable
Review: Begum Hajrat Mahal is quite beautiful, not just kept by the maintenance. It was made to remember Begum Hajrat in ancient time. Must visit.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Famous Attraction
Review: I went to Begum Hazrat Mahal Park. In this tour, you will explore the Begum Hazrat Mahal Park. It was created in 1962. This park was made in the memory of most beautiful and brave women recognized as Begum Hazrat Mahal. It is great place to go.

Name: Rohit T
Title: Ideal for walks and relaxation
Review: One of the few places to relax and for morning/evening walks. Ideal for sumeer evenings and winter afternoons. But these days due to metro construction, all its serene atmosphere is lost and it will remain so for the next two years until the metro project is comleted.

Name: EnakshiC
Title: Saw it in passing
Review: The central architecture an eye catcher which makes the park inviting. One feels like sitting in the shade, while watching the world pass by. The park was mostly empty, probably the heat kept people indoors. There are some rides for children, and of course the attraction of street hawkers and food on the go. Nice place if you want to roam around.

Name: Sonia B
Title: Pretty, but can be better maintained
Review: It's not huge, as some people claim - it's average size with lawns, fountains, and children's play area. But there's stench near the water. Surely, the authorities can do something about the stinking water fountains?However, it's a good place to spend some time with your children. If you do not have kids, don't bother to enter the park; just drive around it, if possible at night, when the monument looks lovely.

Name: BantakalDotCom
Title: Huge Park with Children's Kids Garden in Just 4km from Lucknow Railway Station.
Review: This park is just 4km away from railway station and accessible using sharing auto rickshaw. Park is huge with some trees, a place to sit down, walking track, huge children's play area with swings and many things for kids. Entry to this park is just Rs 5 and food available near to the park. Park also have a free chilled drinking water facility, free washroom etc. Do not forget: If you found this review helpful, please click THANK below.
